post.title: Environmental racism is real and presidential candidates must show how they’ll address it

children.text: Presidential candidates must explain how they will move our nation, our shared home, to an economy with 100 percent clean energy while creating jobs and protecting the most vulnerable from the brunt of devastating health and economic impacts.

live with more air pollution than whites, Environmental Protection Agency scientists found in 2018," writes Dr. Robert Bullard in an op-ed for the Houston Chronicle. "For decades, communities of color in Houston and across the nation have borne a disproportionate burden from this toxic threat. A recent study, for example, found that African Americans are exposed to about 56 percent more pollution than is caused through their consumption of goods and services. For Latinx people, it is even higher, at 63 percent. It’s time for whites to stop dumping their pollution on poor and people of color communities."
